title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

cjdelisle - (09:29): haha yup, that's why I fill my code with comments.  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:31  
Stulle joined #xwiki at 09:33  
Stulle - (09:33): morning  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:35  
vmassol - (09:42): mflorea: pig  
vmassol - (09:42): ping  
mflorea - (09:42): Hi  
vmassol - (09:42): (I wouldn't dare call you "pig" :))  
mflorea - (09:43): :)  
Stulle - (09:43): lol  
vmassol - (09:43): question for you on getImageUR()  
vmassol - (09:43): what happens if the image to be displayed is smaller than the default dimensions  
vmassol - (09:43): ?  
vmassol - (09:43): will it be stretched?  
mflorea - (09:43): nop  
sdumitriu - (09:43): Yeah, my keyboard is getting old, and many times instead of "Salut" I get "Slut"  
vmassol - (09:43): :)  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:44  
mflorea - (09:44): image plugin never reduces the image side below the original dimensions  
mflorea - (09:44): s/side/size  
silviar1 joined #xwiki at 09:44  
vmassol - (09:44): so the params are passed in the query but ignored?  
mflorea - (09:44): this is left for the browser  
mflorea - (09:44): yes  
vmassol - (09:44): hmmm still not perfect but ok I guess...  
sdumitriu - (09:44): mflorea: Are you sure?  
vmassol - (09:45): having icons passed with dimension params doesn't sound perfect to me  
vmassol - (09:45): but I can test that and not send params for icon type  
mflorea - (09:45): sdumitriu: I meant the other way around, the image side is not increased above the original size  
silviar left at 09:46 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds  
vmassol - (09:46): mflorea: yes but my question is when the image is smaller than the passed dimensions  
vmassol - (09:47): so how would you stretch an image?  
mflorea - (09:47): the original image is returned. So, the correct statement is: image plugin never returns an image bigger than the original one.  
vmassol - (09:47): so the image plugin knows the original image dimensions?  
mflorea - (09:47): yes  
vmassol - (09:47): ok  
mflorea - (09:48): it uses the java imageio api to extract them from the image attachment  
vmassol - (09:48): ok  
mflorea - (09:48): and compares the given width/height with the orignal  
cjdelisle - (09:51): is 2.0 going to be the next version of the admin app?  
cjdelisle - (09:51): was that decided on?  
vmassol - (09:52): not fully  
vmassol - (09:52): right now it's a proposal from sergiu  
vmassol - (09:53): I don't remember committers replying (except from me)  
vmassol - (09:53): this needs a new mail thread IMO  
vmassol - (09:53): more general  
vmassol - (09:53): with a proposal from sergiu  
cjdelisle - (09:53): I'm closing an issue and the only option for an unreleased version is 2.0.  
sdumitriu left at 09:54 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
cjdelisle - (09:56): So I'll close as 2.0 then we can revisit later. Sound good?  
tmortagne - (09:56): cjdelisle: the version can be renamed in jira so put 2.0  
cjdelisle - (09:57): Done. Thanks.

vmassol - (10:17): I can do it later on if nobody wants to do it

sburjan - (10:19): secureLaszloCode :)  
cjdelisle - (10:19): Unfortunately, Util is exposed through the api so third parties could be using it.  
cjdelisle - (10:19): Maybe we should wait 2 releases since I just now @Deprecated access to Util  
sburjan - (10:20): hmm ... maybe only the macro or plugins were using it  
fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 10:28  
sburjan - (10:30): tmortagne: can I add some screenshots on the Extension Manager plugin page on how to install the an extension ... like the one we talked yesterday ?

tmortagne - (10:34): sburjan: sure  
Baur - (10:51): I want to get an RSS feed from XWiki on my website and I  want to know how many comments does the feed contain. Is there a way to get the number of comments?  
sburjan - (10:56): tmortagne: i get some conflicts when trying to install on the latest snapshot. I put : id = org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-core-rendering-macro-ruby and  version = 2.5-rc-1. i get the next warnings : extension org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-core-rendering-macro-script is needed in version 2.5-rc-1 but core extension has version 2.5-SNAPSHOT. i tried to put 2.5-SNAPSHOT in the version field, and I get a velocity Macro error  
tmortagne - (10:57): sburjan: hmm i think the issue is version comparison, extension manager probably think "2.5-rc-1" is more recent then "2.5-SNAPSHOT", try with 2.4.3 instead  
sburjan - (11:02): tmortagne: thanks, worked. But I did the screenshots on the ExtensionManager, not from Administration Page  
sburjan - (11:02): hope that's not a big problem  
tmortagne - (11:02): sburjan: why ?  
tmortagne - (11:03): admin page should work well in view at least even if you did not changed the XWikiPreference authoor  
tmortagne - (11:03): s/authoor/author/  
Denis left at 11:03 (Quit: Leaving.  
Denis joined #xwiki at 11:03  
tmortagne - (11:04): but that should not change the screenshot much anyway so as you want it's not critical  
sburjan - (11:04): I'm trying within admin now. yesterday didn't worked .. as you know  
tmortagne - (11:06): sburjan: what i know is that install does not work  
tmortagne - (11:07): but it should show you installed extensions  
tmortagne - (11:07): it's not the same  
sburjan - (11:07): yes, but I wanted to make a mini tutorial on how to install  
tmortagne - (11:07): and i explained to you how to fix it yesterday  
sburjan - (11:07): yes, I know  
tmortagne - (11:08): anyway as i said it's ok  
tmortagne - (11:08): what you did is fine  
tmortagne - (11:08): don't do too much work for an UI that will probably change in 2.7 or something  
cjdelisle - (11:13): Is anyone -1 to ``[xwiki-devs] [proposal] Add filesystem storage for binary objects which are too large for the database.'' ?  
tmortagne - (11:14): cjdelisle: +1 for the title ;) just did not had time to read the whole thing yet  
cjdelisle - (11:14): I'd like to start writing those classes but I don't want to have more unacceptable patches.  
Stulle - (11:19): two suggestions:  
Stulle - (11:19): both for WYSIWYG editor  
Stulle - (11:20): 1. allow use of ctrl + tab, because right now this adds a few spaces rather than change the tab of the browser  
Stulle - (11:21): 2. implement ctrl + pos 1 / ctrl + end to navigate to the very beginning or very end of the currently edited article/section/whatever

florinciu joined #xwiki at 11:24

lucaa - (11:59): ui tests that check that all expected data is there?  
vmassol - (11:59): tmortagne: hmm do we have to remove the clirr checks in the release process? I see they are still there on trunk  
vmassol - (11:59): (let me check the release process)

vmassol - (12:00): fixing it on trunk

vmassol - (12:01): checking....  
vmassol - (12:02): nope… hmm we can decide to put them only in the final release

sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 12:06  
lucaa - (12:06): I'm working on XE-722 and I would like to have an alternative method to ensure I am not messing up anything, besides my own good attention and judgement  
sdumitriu - (12:07): vmassol: Tomorrow I'll be offline most of the day, so I can't start the release  
sdumitriu - (12:07): Do we do a RC2 today?  
vmassol - (12:08): do we need a RC2?  
sdumitriu - (12:08): There have been some changes  
sdumitriu - (12:08): I would release 2.5 directly, but you complained that a final should be just a rename  
vmassol - (12:09): I didn't complain, I asked what people thought  
vmassol - (12:10): I don't think we have many changes right now  
vmassol - (12:10): at least maybe not enough to justifu a RC2 right now  
vmassol - (12:10): we need to check tag deletion  
vmassol - (12:10): I couldn't make them work locally  
vmassol - (12:11): (I'm on trunk though, I'll need a rebuild to test again)  
vmassol - (12:11): we do need to start releasing 2.5 final though I agree  
vmassol - (12:11): (if you're not there tomorrow)  
rrodriguez left at 12:11 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
rrodriguez\_ joined #xwiki at 12:11  
tmortagne - (12:11): vmassol: yes clirr is supposed to be remove when we release a final version  
vmassol - (12:12): sburjan: the release notes for 2.5 are wrong in the api brekaage section  
vmassol - (12:12): http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise25#HAPIBreakages  
vmassol - (12:12): sburjan: where did you take these api breakeages from?  
vmassol - (12:13): (mhmm maybe from an initial milestone)  
sburjan - (12:13): The document is not final. I merged the M1, M2 and RC1 release notes  
sburjan - (12:13): yes  
vmassol - (12:13): tmortagne: we need to decide if we want breakage reports in each release or only in final  
vmassol - (12:13): we used to do it for each version before  
vmassol - (12:13): but we've changed recently  
vmassol - (12:13): (without saying it  
vmassol - (12:13): )  
tmortagne - (12:14): vmassol: i think final is enough since api breakage in milestone is not really important because it could change  
vmassol - (12:14): so we need to decide now  
tmortagne - (12:14): we did not changed btw  
vmassol - (12:14): this means that users trying out our milesontes won'(t see breakages  
vmassol - (12:14): they'll experience them but won't find them in the RN  
tmortagne - (12:14): i always do it in all releases  
vmassol - (12:14): ok sergiu changed then  
vmassol - (12:14): ;)  
sdumitriu - (12:14): Yep  
tmortagne - (12:15): he probably just forgot  
tmortagne - (12:15): ok  
vmassol - (12:15): it's a bit wrong now  
vmassol - (12:15): since M1 shows breakages, M2 seems to be a copy paste of M1  
sburjan - (12:16): yes.. it's a copy  
vmassol - (12:16): (I'm pretty sure M2 has a lot more breakages than what is listed)  
vmassol - (12:16): and RC1 has no breakages listed  
vmassol - (12:16): so it's a mess  
vmassol - (12:16): sdumitriu: what do you want to do?  
sdumitriu - (12:17): About breakages?  
vmassol - (12:17): about documenting them yes  
vmassol - (12:17): and how do we fix the RN  
sburjan - (12:18): vmassol:  : I don't know where to get the correct information regarding this  
rrodriguez\_ left at 12:19 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 12:20  
vmassol - (12:20): IMO we should have them in the RN for each version, wdyt?  
vmassol - (12:21): (as we used to have)  
tmortagne - (12:21): it's not hard to do anyway so it should probably be in each version even if API are not final in milestones  
rrodriguez left at 12:21 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 12:22  
tmortagne - (12:23): vmassol: it's not taht way we are supposed to deal with clirr  
tmortagne - (12:23): (looking at your commit)  
tmortagne - (12:23): API in milestone are not really final  
vmassol - (12:23): yes and?  
tmortagne - (12:23): so it does not make sens compare current with a previous milestone  
tmortagne - (12:24): brekage are only with final versions  
vmassol - (12:24): it's better than comparing with 2.4  
sburjan - (12:24): vmassol: I am on trunk, and deleting tags seems to work for me  
vmassol - (12:24): for trunk  
tmortagne - (12:24): vmassol: not really no  
vmassol - (12:24): it is  
vmassol - (12:24): way better  
tmortagne - (12:24): it's the breakage introduces by 2.5  
tmortagne - (12:24): the version before 2.5 is 2.4  
vmassol - (12:24): trunk is 2.6  
vmassol - (12:24): not 2.5  
tmortagne - (12:24): there is no other  
tmortagne - (12:24): hmm  
vmassol - (12:24): the latest release is 2.5 rc1  
vmassol - (12:25): I'm adding new exclusions  
sburjan - (12:25): vmassol: yes. sorry. I meant latest 2.5 snapshot  
vmassol - (12:25): and i don't want to mix them with old 2.5 exclusions  
tmortagne - (12:25): hmm yes for 2.6-SNAPSHOt it's hard to say  
tmortagne - (12:25): i guess RC is ok in that case  
vmassol - (12:25): yes and it'll need to be modified  
vmassol - (12:25): when final is released  
tmortagne - (12:26): yes  
sdumitriu - (12:26): vmassol: Yes, +1 for breakages in all RN  
rrodriguez left at 12:27 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 12:28  
rrodriguez left at 12:31 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 12:31

sdumitriu - (12:33): Quick check: Does anybody have stuff to commit for 2.5?  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:33  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 12:34  
sburjan - (12:35): want to release final ?  
cjdelisle - (12:36): sdumitriu, ``Actually, these whitespaces are kind of mandatory.'' javadoc requires trailing whitespace?  
sdumitriu - (12:38): No, our codestyle  
sdumitriu - (12:38): sburjan: Yes  
Stulle left at 12:38 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
sburjan - (12:39): sdumitriu: there is the issue regarding OO and ExtensionManager tmortagne send an email today  
sburjan - (12:39): but I guess we can fix that for 2.6  
tmortagne left at 12:39 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne1 joined #xwiki at 12:39  
sburjan left at 12:57 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
tmortagne1 left at 12:57 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 12:57  
Stulle joined #xwiki at 12:59  
vmassol - (13:04): sburjan`: I haven't followed but 1) is it a regression and 2) does it mean people cannot use the office importer?  
vmassol - (13:13): sdumitriu: are you updating the release notes with api breakage info?  
Baur left at 13:13 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
cjdelisle - (13:14): re trailing whitespace: Is this documented? If it's agreed and undocumented then I think it should be documented because it's my understanding that trailing whitespace is generally recognized as bad practice.  
vmassol - (13:19): sdumitriu: I'm curious to have your opinion about "[Proposal] Supporting symbols/emoticons" especially about point B  
tmortagne - (13:24): cjdelisle: it's part of the formater configuration, that's why sdumitriu said it's mandatory  
tmortagne - (13:25): and i agree with him  
cjdelisle - (13:25): What formater is this?  
cjdelisle - (13:25): An IDE plugin?  
tmortagne - (13:26): Eclipse and probbly IDEA too (even if i never used IDEA)  
tmortagne - (13:26): it's not the default formater  
tmortagne - (13:26): it's a formatter configured by us  
cjdelisle - (13:27): Ok, I'd like to add it to the documentation because I don't use an IDE and IMO things like that ought to be documented.  
sdumitriu - (13:27): cjdelisle: See http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/JavaCodeStyle  
tmortagne - (13:27): i don't have string opinion about this trailing space things but the point is that it needs to be aligned with the formatter IMO  
tmortagne - (13:27): s/string/strong/  
sdumitriu - (13:27): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-tools/trunk/xwiki-verification-resources/src/main/resources/codestyle-eclipse.xml  
cjdelisle - (13:29): Is that the only case where trailing whitespace is acceptable?  
vmassol - (13:30): sorry haven't followed. Where does javadoc require trailng WS?  
tmortagne - (13:30): cjdelisle: probably, it's certainly not acceptable at the end of a code line  
cjdelisle - (13:31): In an empty line in a javadoc comment, after the \*  
vmassol - (13:32): sburjan`: did you get time to think about a redesigned XWiki Syntax page? We need to start documenting the XWiki Syntax 2.1  
cjdelisle - (13:33): I don't have a strong opinion on trailing whitespace except that the authority should be the documentation and the IDE formatter config should follow the documentation.  
sdumitriu - (13:34): cjdelisle: Yes, that's the only place  
sdumitriu - (13:34): Actually, this is not configurable  
sdumitriu - (13:35): I guess the rule followed by eclipse is that the javadoc left margin is "\* "  
cjdelisle - (13:35): Does anyone know if there was a proposal in this that I can cite?  
tmortagne - (13:35): sdumitriu: you sure ? maybe it's configurable now  
sdumitriu - (13:35): No matter if there's any content after that or not  
sdumitriu - (13:36): tmortagne: Not sure, but I can't find any setting for that in the codestyle  
tmortagne - (13:36): that probably just mean it's the default  
sdumitriu - (13:36): I'd be +1 for removing that space if the codestyle allows it  
cjdelisle - (13:37): +1 here because it makes it easier to make a big whitespace patch with sed.  
sdumitriu - (13:37): I'm on Galileo (3.5.1)  
tmortagne - (13:38): checking 3.6 configuration UI  
tmortagne - (13:41): can't find anything  
vmassol - (13:42): tmortagne: can you verify one thing for me? Could you run rendering-xwiki RenderingTest in Eclpse and see if all test files (\*.test) from rendering-tests are executed or only the ones in rendering-xwiki?  
tmortagne - (13:45): vmassol: testing but a simple test is to print what URLs you are giving to the Reflexion tool  
vmassol - (13:45): tmortagne: it's not working for me in IDEA  
vmassol - (13:45): it sees other tests  
tmortagne - (13:46): that means you get URL from other jar when you search for resources URLs i think  
tmortagne - (13:46): and the classloader is probably different in Eclipse, maven and IDEA  
tmortagne - (13:47): let me check try to find some code to test in IDEA  
sdumitriu - (13:49): I also have a classpath issue in Eclipse: if xml-apis is pulled, it overrides the JDK classes with older, incomplete versions  
tmortagne - (13:52): vmassol: basically the idea is that we need to find a way to get the URL to the test-classes some way, what we currently use basically is ClassLoader#getResources and i guess when in IDEA there is everything in the classloader where you have only the current things in maven

cjdelisle - (13:56): I'm going to make a proposal that all trailing whitespace is not acceptable except the javadoc comment case in which case it's required. Just so I have something to reference in the documentation.  
cjdelisle - (14:10): I just wrote little c and java aps to read the stdin and write to stdout while swapping all newlines for spaces and spaces for newlines.  
cjdelisle - (14:11): filesize 1.06GB  
cjdelisle - (14:11): java: real 1m34.584s  
cjdelisle - (14:11): c: real 0m52.275s  
cjdelisle - (14:11): 180% of the time cost.  
cjdelisle - (14:12): Not wonderful but definitely competitive for what it is.  
cjdelisle - (14:15): http://pastebin.com/JKjkuydk <-- the code  
sdumitriu - (14:17): cjdelisle: You should count the effective time, not including the jvm startup time  
cjdelisle - (14:17): I know, that's why I used a huge file.  
cjdelisle - (14:18): But you still have to take it into account because it is real, jvms do start up in the real world.
